page.title: 16The Pheasantry - Dunnington
page.content: The Pheasantry is in the grounds of Ragley Hall and is owned by a syndicate of ten people who lease the shooting rights from the Marquess of Hertford. Mr. Ward, the gamekeeper, buys day-old pheasant chicks in boxes of 36 from a farm near High Wycombe. They are housed in an ark and kept warm (35C) with a paraffin heater. At 10 days the chicks are put into an ark with a pen. Plastic clips are fitted to their beaks so that they cannot pull feathers out of each other. As the beaks grow quickly, Mr. Ward has to trim them. After 7 weeks the clips are removed and the birds released into the woods. 1000 birds are released into the 5000 acres around Ragley Hall each year. The chicks are fed on maize, wheat, vitamins and powdered milk. Wild pheasants feed on insects and grubs.
